comments:
Hi,

I had Eclipse installed on my computer for a while and was able to create web projects.  Recently I have installed additional features plus ran update on the features already installed.  Then I tried to create a new Dynamic Web Project  and got an error message.  Not being able to find out what was wrong and assuming that one of the new features or updates I've just added caused the problem and not being prepared to investigate which update/new feature was playing up I removed Eclipse from my computer with all its features; I've removed the eclipse directory and started from the scratch.

I went on Eclipse website downloaded the Eclipse zip file.  Installed it then used Help->Software Updates->Find/Install... to install Web Tools.  Then I went to Window->preferences->Installed Runtimes and added Apache Tomcat5.5
Next I tried again to create a Dynamic Web Project.

Here it is step by step what I've done:
1. Selected File->New->Project
2. On pop up window 'New Project Select Wizard' I've selected 'Dynamic Web Project' clicked 'Next' button.
3. I entered the name of the project as 'test'
4. Accepted defaults. Target runtime "Apache Tomcat5.5'; Configurations :<custom>
5. On 'Project Facets' accepted defaults: ticked 'Dynamic Web Module 2.4' and 'Java 5.0' and clicked 'Finish' button.
6.  After a while a pop-up window 'Inconsistent files' appeared with a message 
"The following workspace files are inconsistent with the editor: update editor with workspace contents?" and in a white area the value: "\test\.settings\org.eclipse.wst.common.component" and two buttons "Yes" and "Now".  First time I've pressed "Yes" button.
7.  New pop-up ERROR window appeared with message:
"Failed while installing Dynamic Web Module 2.4.
Reason:
Failed while installing Dynamic Web Module 2.4.".  Clicking on 'Details >>' button revealed additional info:
"Failed while writing preferences.
Exception occurred while saving project preferences: /test/.settings/org.eclipse.jst.common.project.facet.core.prefs"
Clicking 'OK' button creates the project.
8.  I've entered the data for the project (html pages, java code etc). 
9.  Then I've tried to export project to a war file and the project name ('test' did not appear 'Web module' selection box.  I assume Eclipse did not recognise my new project as a web project.

I have noticed:
1. I have noticed that in project Properties there were missing two options: Web Content Settings and Web project Settings.
2.  I created a new Home.html file using option New->Other and selecting in 'Select Wizard' Web->HTML. When I tried to make changes a pop-up window "File Changed" appeared with a message "The file has been changed on the file system.  Do you want to load changes?" 

After creating test project I have checked .log file in /eclipse/workspace/.metadata directory.  Here it is the content of that file:

!SESSION 2007-01-22 11:45:07.457 -----------------------------------------------

java.version=1.5.0_10

BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_AU
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

I have searched the bug?s database for answers but was unable to find the one applicable to what I was experiencing.  I googled the web for answers and haven't found them there.   As a last resort I have created this bug report.

Thank you

Monika

PS I have a Mac with Intel Core 2 Duo processor with "bootcamp" installation of Windows XP.
